fields.description:
The dashboard can quickly get cluttered up when there are several projects going on, everyone want their graphs and charts, tables etc. on the dashboard.   While some of the "multiple-dashboards" proposals address this more or less (e.g. by allowing saving/loading/sharing of dashboards), I think a project-specific dashboard, controlled by the project lead and viewable by anyone whose permissions allow them to view the project, would be helpful.  It would show up as a tab in the 'browse project' set.  There may be filters that the particular group likes to use, just for their project, graphs they want to see, handy portlets for the project processes, etc. without losing the view of the 'main' dashboard(s).

Example: The 'preset filters' on the current page are somewhat limited, and there is no way to tweak them and have the tweaked version show up in the project page.  So they end up in the big global filter bucket on the main dashboard, where other project members who don't need them are forced to deal with them.

Example: A project lead wants the team to see a burndown chart, time-tracking, or one of the new jfreechart created/resolved charts on the project page.

The ability to customize/add portlets to the existing 'open issues' tab would be useful as well.
fields.summary: configurable dashboard-like 'browse project' tab

fields.description:
While running a large import Jelly script (85,000 comments added), we noted what appears to be a significant memory leak.  It is problematic because this makes it a bit of a crap shoot as to whether the job will finish and because each addcomment is atomic, the incomplete jobs leave us with a messy state to sort out (e.g. figure out which comments were added multiple times because the job was rerun).

Symptoms include odd behavior of the job and very high, non-decreasing memory utilization post batch.  The job runs very rapidly for a while and then mysteriously pauses for -2-3 hours before continuing at a much lower throughput.  Sometimes, the job hangs with apparently, no hope of ever finishing.  When the job is complete, memory utilization remains extremely high (e.g. > 95%) and never comes down...even when garbage collection is forced.  The only resolution is to bounce the server.  

Other notes:
1.  The entire job consisted of AddComment Jelly tags
2.  The source file was locally stored on the server (so no funny business with network latency or something along those lines)
3.  The server was bounced prior to the start of the job to insure that there was no DB lock or system resource contention
4.  There was no non-Jira related activity on the system during this process (e.g. backups)
5.  E-mail notifications were disabled during the running of this script

Thanks,
Ted
fields.summary: Memory leak in Jelly Runner while using AddComment tags

fields.description:
While installing the WAR version of JIRA 3.5 I had forgotten to fix the entityEngine.xml to mssql. When I logged in to JIRA it said that the database type mapping was incorrect and to change it, which I did and then restarted JIRA.

JIRA then crashed fairly spectacularly with a SQLException while executing the following:INSERT INTO propertyentry (ID, ENTITY_NAME, ENTITY_ID, PROPERTY_KEY, propertytype) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Cannot insert the value NULL into column 'ID', table 'jac_production_db.jirauser.propertyentry'; column does not allow nulls. INSERT fails. For full details/pain please see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-3966

So, if JIRA can tell that the database mapping is incorrect, shouldn't it NOT create the tables incorrectly? It would have saved me quite a bit of pain. Also, if it can tell, why do we need to set it explicitly in the first place?
fields.summary: Do not create database if Database Type mapping is incorrect in entityEngine.xml

fields.description:
From time to time firefox interpretes accessed JIRA pages as "BIN" files and offers download of this page. The resulting file is recognized as zipped file, but gunzip unzips 0 bytes and "ignores trailing trash".

This is difficult to track down as our tomcat is behind an apache and I can't turn apaches mod_gzip off. Jira itself does not zip content.

The bug shows only from time to time, reload or repeating an action usually helps, thus it is not a major bug but rather annoying.

If somebody can tell me where to look for more information once it happens again, please tell me. As I currently cannot give good steps to reproduce, feel free to resolve this as "cannot reproduce". Otherwise I'll report when it happens again (gunzip has just deleted my last downloaded file and replaced it with 0 bytes, so I cannot attach it here)
fields.summary: Pages sometimes not shown but offered for download

fields.description:
Our Mantis-DB contains one user who has used a german umlaut character in his name - this user will be imported into jira, but will not be editable from within the application (we needed to change the users name via the database backend).
The user browser will link to secure/admin/user/ViewUser.jspa?name=m%F6ller, a name that is not available to change it.

I'm not sure about the preferred solution though - the umlaut could be ignored and deleted from the name (hoping that this will not result in duplicates). Ideally the application would find the user addressed with the %F6 letter, but I believe this will be harder work as there are so many more special characters and different encoding issues.
fields.summary: Mantis Importer imports unusable users if they contain special characters

fields.description:
I want to restore JIRA data from backup after setting up a new installation of 3.5 Enterprise, standalone.

In the screen "Restore JIRA data from backup" is there a field for "File name", with the added information that I can leave it blank and paste my XML below.

Now, where is this "below"? There are only two other fields, index location and License, and none of these seems like the right place to paste a huge amount of XML data.

Furthermore, if I leave the file name field blank I get an error that says that I must enter the location of an XML file which contradicts the notion of importing pasted data.
fields.summary: Caption to enter backup XML when setting up JIRA still references 'paste' option

fields.description:
1. Create components within a project
2. Hide component/s for the project
3. The issue navigator still has the component/s searcher.
fields.summary: Components shown on Issue Navigator even if they are hidden

fields.description: The MultiIssueKeySearcher custom field needs a searchParameter to correctly create a query string that the searcher can understand. At the moment we use a GenericMultiValueParameter to contain the values and this generates a query string of the form &customfield_10070=HLP-1&customfield_10070=HLP-2 but the searcher expects a query string of the form &customfield_10070=HLP-1,HLP-2. This is not a rush job since we don't support the toolkit, but we should fix it when we get a chance.
fields.summary: JIRA Toolkit bug - The MultiIssueKeySearcher custom field needs a searchParameter to correctly create a query string that the searcher can understand
Add option through the RPC interface

fields.description:
Often I know that I've typed enough keywords in the search so that the first issue will be the one I want to see.

There should be a way to jump into the first search result from the quick search, without the intervening list of issues.

Analogy: the Firefox address bar, where typing more than one word does a Google "I'm Feeling Lucky" search, and jumps straight to the first result.

Possible solutions:

* Quick search box has an onkeypress event that traps control-Enter and sets a hidden field.
* Typing some special character or word in the search text does it, e.g. "lucky: firefox horizontal scrollbar".
fields.summary: "I'm Feeling Lucky"-type search from quick search box.

fields.summary: Full Stop in status name causes IllegalArgumentException
SOAP addAttachments should have an alternative more efficient implementation

fields.description:
When using the Documentation Link custom field to integrate with Confluence, there is a "Search Confluence" icon next to the field. Click it, to find the Confluence page you are interested in.

On Firefox, it works fine, but on IE, no popup window is displayed, and the following error box appears:

Line 784
Character 9
Error: Invalid argument
Code: 0
URL: <url of page I was just on>

My IE version is 6.0.2900.2180.xpsp_sp2_gdr.050301-1519
fields.summary: Documentation Link field searcher doesn't work in IE 6.0

fields.description: Priority field alone seems to be too coarse for prioritizing issues. For example there may be dozens of Major issues and hunders of Minor ones. It would be very useful to have additional field like 'precedence' to order/prioritize issues within same Priority group. Then navigator can provide up/down arrows for each issue to visualy move issues up and down.
fields.summary: Provide more granular issue ordering in navigator

fields.description: The browse project page, open issues tab, presents a nice short summary of hte project, it would be nice to see the version description when you hover on the version name (just like what happens when you mouse onto a component name).
fields.summary: show version description on mouseover of the version link wherever it appears in the ui, for example the browse project page

fields.description: When exporting an issue, the custom fields appear at the bottom of the document instead of above the description, as on screen.
fields.summary: Word export shows custom fields at bottom of document

fields.description: I've assigned the 'Priority' and 'Fixed Verion(s)' fields to appear in the 'Assign Issue' screen, however they don't appear in the 'Assign Issue' screen. Instead, if the issue is resolved, the fields appear in the 'Close Issue' screen instead. If closing an issue from Open state, the 'Close Issue' screen appears as normal with the resolution and fixed version fields.
fields.summary: Assign Issue screen does not appear on Assign Issue page

fields.description:
Enabling a disabled plugin requires a restart. 

So when you start up with the charting plugin disabled and enable it, the *portlets* associated with it doesn't get reloaded properly. You also can't seem to add any new portlets until you restart. Custom fields seem okay
fields.summary: Enabling a disabled plugin requires a restart

fields.description:
1. make an issue with summary by Korean character
2. you can't find the issue through text search.

in addition if you make the summary by English and Korean together, you couldn't find the issue also.(in spite of searching with English word)

I searched this problem and I found one.
But I couldn't find any comment for the issue.

thank you.
fields.summary: Text search doesn't operate with Korean character.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9201].
  {panel}

As we are using JIRA also as kind of a service desk tool, it would be very helpful, to easily identifiy issues, which are overdue. (todays date > due date). For this reason a new feature should be implemented:

1a. Create a Switch in "user preferences" called "highlight overdue issues"
1b. Create a switch on the search issue page, where you can dynamically switch highlighting on and off.
2. Highlight every row in a filter result in "light red" , where the due date is yesterday or older
3. Highlight every row in a filter result in "yellow", where the due date is today.
4. Do not highlight anything else.

Would be great to easily see, which tasks are overdue, and which tasks are still in time.

My guess: about 1-2 days of effort. What do you think?
fields.summary: Highlight issues red, which are late or overdue

fields.description:
For processes which rely heavily on issue linking, there is no way to easily determine the issue types of linked issues in the current Issue Links view.

For a mere 16 or so pixels, the view could be modified to include the icon specified for each linked issue.  You could also set the tool tip so that it would display the issue type name on a mouse-over of the icons.

To further streamline the presentation, please implement a sort on the view by Issue Type, Status and then Priority.  Alternately, if you could allowi the adimistrators to specify the sort order in a configuration file, that would suffice.
fields.summary: Display Issue Type Icon in Issue Links Section and Sort Linked Issues by Type, Status, Priority

fields.description:
As we're migrating groups to Jira, I keep running into the same problem over and over again.  Workflow migrations deadlock in the DB on user actions and I have to get our server bounced to unhang the system.  Particularly in the early phases of a rollout as workflows are being migrated, this is a critical need.  

There needs to be a way to put the system into a maintenance mode so that any existing end user sessions are terminated (along with the associated freeing of database locks) and new user logins need to be prevented.  It would be handy if the system would put up a nice message along the lines of  "I'm busy now...please come back later".  

As a corollary to this, it would be handy to be able to get a list of logged on users and their last moment of activity although I freely acknowledge that this is a bit hard in a web environment.
fields.summary: Workflow migrations deadlock in the DB if there are active users on the system.  System needs a "maintenance mode".

There is currently no way for users to reliably search on closed issues by date through the filter interface.  We are currently handicapped by the following set of problems...

1.  There is no system defined "closed date" that can be used via the filter interface
2.  The system doesn't support the definition of a hidden custom field that can be defaulted to the current date for closure
3.  Default dates always default to 01-Jan-01 if I were inclined to try to leave the closure date visible on a screen and default it for users.

It sure would be handy to have this functionality.

fields.description:
Say a user has accidentally registered twice, first as 'jbloggs', second as 'joe', which is the account they use, in all the right groups. Both accounts will have the same email address. This is usually not a problem, except when using a POP/IMAP service to create issues automatically.  The mail handler uses the email address to find out the user. If there is more than one user with the same email address, it will pick the first match ('jbloggs') which may not be the right one - eg. it may not have permission to create issues.  In this case, JIRA places the email in the error queue.

To avoid this, we should either enforce email uniqueness, or print a warning when an account is created using an existing email address.

h3. Workaround
We can use the following SQL query to identify the users with duplicated e-mail addresses to know which users to edit.
{code:SQL}
with users as (
	select lower_user_name, lower_email_address 
	from cwd_user CU
	join cwd_directory CD on CU.directory_id = CD.id and CD.active = 1
	group by lower_user_name, lower_email_address),
duplicated as (
	select lower_email_address from users
	group by lower_email_address 
	having count(lower_email_address) > 1)
select U.lower_user_name, U.lower_email_address, CD.directory_name , coalesce (UA.attribute_name, 'login.count') as attribute_name, coalesce (UA.attribute_value,'0') as attribute_value
from duplicated D
join cwd_user U on D.lower_email_address = U.lower_email_address 
join cwd_directory CD on U.directory_id = CD.id
left join cwd_user_attributes UA on UA.user_id = U.id and UA.attribute_name = 'login.count'
order by u.lower_email_address, attribute_value desc;
{code}

Please note if you need to edit a user not in the *Jira Internal Directory*, you'll most likely need to change the e-mail address in the LDAP server directly, unless you use a *Delegated directory* without the *Update User attributes on Login* setting.

You can use the [Update User REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/latest/#api/2/user-updateUser] to speed up the process.
fields.summary: Having two users with the same email address can cause email problems

I'm implementing a project for managing our hiring process. A high-level requirement I have is for a report that shows who is holding on to issues too long and slowing up the hiring queue.

Dimensions to report on:
- project
- user
- issue type
- status
- amount of time a user has held the issue

How awesome would it be to have this data exported into an Excel pivot table? This would allow managers to easily slice-n-dice the data to police the Project.

fields.description:
On the project overview page, the little bar graphs under project summary and open issues aren't really useful.  I don't really care how much about the statistics across a whole project. It doesn't help too much to know that we have 1587 closed bugs.  It would however be much  more useful to know these figures for a particular version.  When our whole team is working hard towards a milestone/version it would be very useful to see the chart of who has the most bugs assinged to them, or how many critical bugs we have left, or how many bugs we've closed so far for that release.  Those would be very useful things. 

It is possible somehow to get these graphs to show the figures per version?  Currently when I click on the version name I am just brought to the issue navigator, pre-filtered for that version.  But a dashboard view of the version/release would be much more useful.  Is there a way to get this sort of information?  

I found the "Single Level Group By Report" which helps *some*, but isn't as nice at a glance as the few bar graphs.

Thanks!
Evan Leonard
fields.summary: Project Graphs per Version?

The attachment adds the following improvements to BugzillaImportBean.java:
- Create Issue Links with type "Duplicate" (and create this link type if it doesn't exist).
- Create Component Leads.
- Concatenate field URL to field Environment.
fields.summary: Bugzilla Import improvements: Issue Links "Duplicate", Component Leads, URL

fields.description:
For reporting purposes I want to assign a numerical weight to each issue priority.

For example:
Low = 1; Medium = 10; High = 25; Critical = 25; Blocker = 50.

However, I don't want to have to rely on user to independently set this value.
How do I create a field called, for-example, "Priority Weight" that takes a value dependent on the chosen value of the "Priority" field?

It possible to approximate this behaviour using the custom field type "Cascade Select" but the values in the two select list appeared concatenated by a hyphen on the issue navigator. I want the "Priority Weighting" to appear in a seperate column - so that it can be summed.
fields.summary: How can the value of a field be set to be dependent on that of another field?

fields.description:
The greek calendar translated javascript files are corrupted and result in javascript runtime errors which prevent the opening of the pop-up window. The problem probably lies in the 
tlassian-jira\includes\js\calendar\lang\orig\calendar-el.js file which contains an extra space at first line before the comment {{// ** I18N}}. So the encoded calendar file in the parent folder gets some extra invalid chars {{\ufeff// ** I18N}}. When we've removed the extra chars the pop-up worked as expected.
fields.summary: Greek calendar javascript contains invalid characters

fields.description:
From user:

Would be nice to be able to update the cvs view/fisheye base url without pulling the entire cvs log again. Not the biggest deal, but a bit of a pain for big projects.
fields.summary: Should be able to update the cvs view URL without regenerating the CVS log

fields.description:
Unfortunately, the danish alphabet contains three special letters: "æ, ø, å". If a persons name contains one or more of these letters, the From field in a JIRA notification looks peculiar as can be seen from the attachment. The correct name is "Jørn Gaardsvig Nielsen" as shown in the contents of the notification. However, in the From field this has been garbled considerably.

Is there any way to circumvent this?
fields.summary: Problem with danish characters in From field of notifications
Auto (bulk) assign to reporter or project lead

fields.description:
After updating (from 3.2 to 3.4.3!), I have noticed that the second option is sometimes lost when changing an issue.

This doesn't happen with all issues.  When I edit or resolve the issue, the custom field for our account/subaccount shows the main account, but the sub account says 'Please select...'  It is clearly set when looking at the issue.  If I submit my changes, the secondary option is lost.

As people are making updates to the issues, we are losing this data rapidly!
fields.summary: Cascading Select loses second option when changing issue in Opera

fields.description: Our users are using the word "locale" in the query field when doing a text search and the results they get back have the word "local" in them as well as "locale". How would one go about searching for exact text string matches? The Search Query Syntax page didn't give any information regarding this.
fields.summary: text search query question
Create rss/xml links by string instead of by id

fields.description:
I find the feature that assigns the first CC member with the issue created by email is pretty useless: when users are reporting issues they do not know what an "assigner" is, they only know they have an issue. 

If they put people on the cc list is because they want those people to be aware of the following discussion, and as such I think that there should be an option to add those people as watchers to the issue opened with an e-mail messae.
fields.summary: Add the CC list members as watchers when creating issues by e-mail

fields.description:
RSS view for bugs collection currently lists N ("tempMax") bugs in no obvious order. While there is a way to set the N (http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-8214), it seems impossible to specify "start" issue, in the same way it is done in the issue navigator.

The reason I ask for this is that I need to download a large set of issues. One thing I can do is to set N high enough and then pray that Jira won't crash or throw OutOfMemory () -- and there would be enough time for a prayer, because I'll be waiting at this side of the wire for quite a long time before first bytes come.

What I would rather do, is the set N to a fixed number, say, 100, and fire requests at the server with "start=0", "start=100", "start=200", etc. -- in essense, paging through the result set. The response for each step is likely to come quicker and not to harm the Jira instance. (There could be problems with concurrent paging and modifications though...)
fields.summary: Add paging to RSS/XML view

fields.description: When ever trying to fill in a date field (for example "due date" field, or "Created after"), and selecting the date from the calendar pop up, I get "You did not enter a valid date. Please enter the date in the format "d-MMM-yy". It's not possible to give day with one digit and month with three?!
fields.summary: Due date / date cannot be entered at all

fields.description:
Would like to be able to 'retroactively' log work so that a weekly timecard could be created.  We've installed the 'time tracking pivot table' plugin, however, we can't retroactively go back a fill in a timecard.

If a date could be specified when logging work, I think we'd be set.
